title: In Contrast
writeup: In contrast to my previous portfolio, which felt busy and noisy, my goal with this iteration was to embrace minimalism while still incorporating some flair. I opted for a two-toned, high-contrast color palette accented by splashes of color and subtle movement. My intention was to present myself and highlight my skill set without overwhelming visitors with too many distractions.

Each section is designed around a message and utilizes an animating element, a color-applied element, and a highlight font. Although these elements are not mutually exclusive, the color emphasizes the focus of a section, while the animations and font enhance the message conveyed by that focal point. For example, the red heart symbolizes my love for development, and the font accentuates the action in the animating statements. Vertical lines between sections break up white space, making each scroll meaningful. Finally, a white noise overlay softens the high contrast and breathes life into the site.

title: Tech Messages
writeup: Tech Messages is a user-friendly forum application designed to foster communication and collaboration. Registered users can seamlessly create, delete, reply to, and modify their posts within various discussion threads. The application emphasizes engagement by showcasing recent post activity in user-generated threads upon login, as well as providing access to active discussions created by others.

The front end is crafted using Handlebars, a powerful and dynamic templating engine that exceeded my expectations in terms of flexibility. For the backend, a MySQL database is utilized to manage thread activity, while bcrypt is employed to securely hash and store user passwords, ensuring robust data protection. While writing complex SQL can be enjoyable, integrating an ORM allowed me to focus on other crucial functionalities of the app, streamlining the development process.
The final result is an intuitive and efficient forum platform that highlights the latest thread activity within a sleek, distraction-free interface, providing a seamless user experience.

title: Coding Kombat Quiz
writeup: Coding Kombat Quiz is one of my earliest creations, and despite its age, it remains a cherished project. The initial goal was straightforward: develop a timed quiz app. However, I wanted to take it a step further by gamifying the experience. My vision was an interface inspired by retro arcade machines and fighting games. Players would select a character and face increasingly challenging question sets, each represented by enemy characters. Correct answers would trigger attacks, while too many wrong choices or running out of time would result in defeat.

While my ambition outpaced my early web development skills, especially given the one-week deadline, I was fortunate to have prior experience with 2D sprite sheets, animations, and basic game loops. The challenge was integrating these elements into a cohesive application.

Though I couldn't implement all the game features I envisioned, the final product still captures the essence of my original idea. The quiz generator is designed for easy expansion, allowing for the inclusion of more difficult question banks. The main game loop, while functional, is set up for future refactoring to support multiple matches. Character selection is also ready for additional fighters, though the animation controllers will need adjustments to accommodate character-specific moves.

title: Break-Sweat
writeup: Break-Sweat is a fitness web application designed to empower users in achieving their workout goals. With a rich database of exercises and workouts, personalized recommendations, and progress tracking features, the platform aims to deliver a tailored fitness experience for users of all levels.

As a collaboration project, my primary responsibility was building the backend using technologies such as Handlebars, MySQL, Express, Node.js, and bcrypt for secure user authentication. I also played a key role in connecting the backend data to the Handlebars templates and ensuring seamless integration. Additionally, I managed the repository, overseeing branch merges and maintaining the project's codebase. We pulled a wide range of exercises and routines from an external API and structured the database to store this data efficiently, minimizing the need for repeated API calls.

Unfortunately, the final product fell short of our initial goals. While the backend was fully functional, fetching and storing all necessary data effectively, the front-end team faced challenges that prevented them from fully integrating this data into the user interface. As a result, the application does not currently display the rich data we've prepared on the backend. Despite these setbacks, the project highlights the importance of cohesive team collaboration and the robustness of the backend architecture that I developed.

title: Weather Ornought
writeup: Weather Ornought is a user-friendly weather application designed to provide both current weather conditions and a 5-day forecast for any searched or saved location. The interface is streamlined to keep all relevant information on a single, easily digestible page, ensuring that users can quickly understand both current and future weather conditions. The design prioritizes the current forecast, accompanied by weather-related images and icons for immediate visual confirmation, while the 5-day forecast offers just enough detail for effective planning.

This project served as a practical application of my skills in jQuery, Bootstrap, and API integration. I leveraged jQuery to programmatically build and update the app's design and HTML elements, while Bootstrap was utilized to expedite the styling process. The weather data is sourced from the OpenWeatherMap API, ensuring reliable and up-to-date information. To enhance user convenience, the app saves and displays the six most recent searches as clickable sections, allowing for quick retrieval of updated weather data.
The result is a clean, efficient weather app that balances comprehensive data presentation with ease of use, making weather updates both accessible and visually intuitive.
